WRITING.TITLE: Plowshare - US Government's Plan for Peaceful Alternative uses for Nuclear Weapons

WRITING.TEXT: BLOOD AND GUTS AND BLOOD AND GUTS AND BLOOD AND GUTS

We already know that Slan and SkullKnight have some sort of past connection together from the banter they exchange in Qliphoth. I would imagine that in the future we will be able to glean at least a few more details regarding Slan and Void and their past dealings with Sir Skull

Skullknight warned Guts that what he wants may not be what Casca wants. Its clear that Guts is still in love with Casca and wants her sanity restored so he can be with her again. But if Casca remembers the Guts's assault on her, it may very well be a key factor in her rejecting him once she's sane again.

I think your right in that it was a screw up, because the Holy Chain Iron Knights question how Serpico got the position in the knights that he has, yet in another scene refer to him as her flunky brother. Its a direct contradiction, if they knew he was her brother than they would assume thats why he has the job.
The fact that they didn't cut that scene from the anime seems to lead credence to the idea that it has a part to play in the Skullknight's warning to Guts.

While i'm not aware of any nuclear weapons based infrastructure projects in the United States, there have in the past been various projects related to medical research and psyops testing that were conducted on various civilian populations by the American government. In particular, MKUltra comes to mind, where the US Government tested mind control and psyops techniques on unwitting subjects in the populace, giving unsuspecting individuals LSD and other drugs in experiments.

A great many of the blasts in the soviet equivalent of this program were either very deep underground or in extremely remote areas with very little population (like in Siberia). It makes me wonder though if the Soviet program had any impact on the food supply of local indigenous communities in the areas surrounding the blasts in Russia.

There also were very few propositions as to how the port should be utilized, given the low population of the area, the fact that the port would be closed in by ice for most of the year, and that the area is detached from the US/Canada highway network.

[The Soviets actually did enact a program like this](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_Explosions_for_the_National_Economy), they used nuclear blasts to shut down out of control oil and gas well fires, geological sounding research, and excavating natural gas storage chambers. These blasts went on until 1988, and there are advocates in Russia to restart the program, largely for the purpose of putting out uncontrolable oil and gas well fires that no other means have been able to put out.

WRITING.TEXT: Someone about a year ago posted story-board type threads with shots from other movies that proved its possible to film at the very least the Golden Age parts of the story. The black swordsman arc is probably filmable as well. Anything beyond that would likely require a massive budget due to the large amounts of CGI needed. It would not surprise me at all if Netflix actually went forward with a live action adaptation of Berserk, given that they have already shown an interest in other live action anime adaptations and that they have shown an interest in Berserk in general by streaming the Berserk films on their site.

WRITING.TEXT: While the SpaceX feat is amazing, [things will really not take off with commercial space travel until fully reusable systems are implement. NASA has attempted to develop single stage to orbit systems in the past, notably the X-33, but these have all failed.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zlFVCRgp_Ss index=1 list=PL3X9klhRW1dmMugj7qypQc28K_u_RfIW8) I think if Reaction Engines can get its Skylon SSTO system fully developed, that they will leave SpaceX in the dust in terms of reduced launch costs.

WRITING.TEXT: It largely depends on if they were up or down wind of the fallout zone. They certainly had some level of exposure to be sure though, the US Government eventually set up [a claim fund for soldiers and others who suffered illnesses due to atomic weapons testing like this.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radiation_Exposure_Compensation_Act)
Indeed, virtually his entire life has been spent as her protector. Once there is another man who is that and more in her life, his purpose in life is lost (which means he might soon be apostle food).

No, its because he is afraid of what Guts might do to her. During Serpico's fight with Guts, [Miura lets us dip into Serpico's mind, and directly shows us that Serpico fears Guts will end up killing Farnese by accident.](http://imgur.com/uD4tEND)

WRITING.TEXT: I was gonna work back through the chapters and find more examples, but i think you got the best of the lot right there lol

[One misty, moisty, morning, When cloudy was the weather, I met up with an old man All clothed in leather, He was clothed all in leather, With a cap under his chin. Singin how'd you do? And how'd you do? And how'd you do again?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pGwnfo40VdI)
Miura also makes a point of showing [Farnese blatently staring at Guts in various panels.](http://imgur.com/239qjCx)

Nothing in the framework of the story prevents there having been more than the five godhand we see now. Its possible there was a sixth one that was killed by Skullknight (void has six fingers on his hand?). Also we get some further allusions of SkullKnight being Gaiseric when he meets Slan in qliphoth and she referes to him as "Your magesty".

WRITING.TEXT: Interestingly enough, [in the 1960's NASA studied building large space stations in lunar orbit and in the moon's Lagrangian points.](https://youtu.be/UcO_BjXfhhc) These stations were to be built of lunar sourced materials and not serve as mere waypoints, but were to be built with the goal of establishing space colony's.
)No idea about the panel your refering to, but when i saw your username, [i instantly thought of this movie lol](https://youtu.be/xulXFB3-A3c?t=258)
Vinland Saga and Wolfsmund are the two that are closest to berserk that i've seen.
